qas.question: The initial state of earth was what?
What formed on the outside of the earth after it cooled?
How does the mass of the moon compare to earth?
What created a primordial atmosphere on earth?
Ice from what source helped to create earths oceans?

plausible_answers.text: volcanism and frequent collisions with other bodies

qas.question: What caused the Earths early crust to become molten?

plausible_answers.text: the outer layer of the planet

qas.question: What cooled allowing water to collect?

plausible_answers.text: the outer layer of the planet cooled to form a solid crust

qas.question: What happened when water started to accumulate on the surface?

plausible_answers.text: Mars-sized object with about 10% of the Earth's mass impacting the planet

qas.question: What caused a piece of the earth to break of and form the moon?
How does the mass of the moon compare to the earths mass?

context: Earth was initially <a0_0>molten<a0_0/> due to extreme <b5_0>volcanism and frequent collisions with other bodies<b5_0/>. Eventually, <b6_0><b7_0>the outer layer of the planet<b6_0/> cooled to form <a1_0>a solid crust<b7_0/><a1_0/> when water began accumulating in the atmosphere. The Moon formed soon afterwards, possibly as the result of a <b8_0>Mars-sized object with <a2_0><b9_0>about 10% of the Earth's mass<b9_0/><a2_0/> impacting the planet<b8_0/> in a glancing blow. Some of this object's mass merged with the Earth, significantly altering its internal composition, and a portion was ejected into space. Some of the material survived to form an orbiting moon. <a3_0>Outgassing and volcanic activity<a3_0/> produced the primordial atmosphere. Condensing water vapor, augmented by ice delivered from <a4_0>comets<a4_0/>, produced the oceans.
